Title: Object: Le Repos en Egypte à l'âne bâté
Description: Rest on the flight into Egypt; holy family sheltering beneath tree in rocky, lush landscape, donkey grazing behind. 1871 Etching, on pale grey chine collé
Curator's comments: (Text from 'From Manet to Toulouse-Lautrec', BM 1978, cat.5) No impression of the first state of the etching is known, except in the form of a lithographic transfer (see 1921,0622.1). This is an impression of the second state which was drastically reworked in about 1880. The underlying design of the first state which had been transferred in 1873 can be made out.
Bibliographic references: Van Gelder 1976 / Rodolphe Bresdin: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé (138.II)
Exhibition history: 1978 Mar-Oct, BM, From Manet to Toulouse-Lautrec, cat. no.5
